Title: Series: Recueil de 283 estampes gravées à l'eau forte d'après les dessins originaux... que Mons. Evrard Jabach de Cologne... possédait
Series: Cabinet Jabach
Description: Rest during the flight into Egypt (Madonna dello Scodello), with Child standing beside the seated Virgin and taking the fruits that St Joseph has picked from a palm tree bent by the angels; after Correggio Etching
Curator's comments: From a series reproducing drawings from the Jabach collection, see 1922,0501.1 for comment. Print after Correggio's altarpiece, originally in the church of the Santo Sepolcro in Parma, removed thence in 1796, now in the Galleria Nazionale, Parma. A scene from the journey in Egypt based on the apocryphal gospel of Pseudo-Matthew. See Gould, 1976, p. 263-265. Printed in reverse. Mussini, 'Correggio Tradotto', 1995, p. 211 identifies this print as a rare unlettered first state of a print by Charles Masse'.
Associated places: Associated with: Parma (city) (Church of Santo Sepolcro)
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Clayton Mordaunt Cracherode (with Philipe's oval blindstamp and initials CMC)
